info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:11PM EDT until September 12 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PERSON...SOUTHWESTERN GRANVILLE AND NORTHWESTERN DURHAM COUNTIES... At 409 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Rougemont, or 12 miles west of Creedmoor, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported a downed tree near Schley, NC. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Butner, Rougemont, Stem, Lake Michie, Lake Butner, Moriah, Berea and Bahama. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
